== Ask for Help & Support ==

You are asking for Help and Support because you did not find what you are looking for on <nowiki>[[https://www.google.com/ | Google]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[http://www.googlubuntu.com/ | Google Ubuntu Search Engine]]</nowiki>. It is very important to start from there as you may find the answer that you need without waiting for someone else to provide you with an answer.

Please read <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/support/community | Community support Overview]]</nowiki>  <<BR>>

=== Mailing Lists ===
As described '''<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/ContactUs#Contact_Us | here]]</nowiki>'''.

=== Ubuntu Forums ===

'''<nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/ | Ubuntu Forums]]</nowiki>''' has many sections divided as per the categories and the nature of the content.
* If you are a newcomer, we recommend to use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=326 | Absolute Beginners Section]]</nowiki>.
* If you are an average/advanced user, you can use <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=327 | Ubuntu General Support]]</nowiki>.

Please remember to use the '''GNOME prefix''' when posting, this will ensure a faster response to your thread. 

Before starting a new thread, please search for a similar issue. 

=== Live Chat ===
We have an IRC channel on irc.freenode.net, called '''#ubuntu-gnome'''. This is our main channel where day to day conversations and support relating to Ubuntu GNOME take place.

==== How to connect ====
* Help on connecting to IRC is available on <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat | this link]]</nowiki>.
* If you donâ€™t have an IRC client installed, you can also use <nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-gnome | the Freenode web-based client]]</nowiki>.

==== More Information ====
* <nowiki>[[http://www.eifl.net/irc-beginners-guide | What is IRC?]]</nowiki>
* If your question is not answered, wait another 30 minutes before re-posting. Please read the guide to asking questions: <nowiki>[[http://workaround.org/getting-help-on-irc | How to get help on IRC]]</nowiki>

==== Other Useful Channels ====

* '''#ubuntu''' can be used for support queries that are more generic and not too GNOME specific.
* '''#ubuntu+1''' can be used to discuss generic issues related to running Ubuntu development releases

=== Ask Ubuntu ===
Do you have a specific question with a specific answer?<<BR>>
Ask on <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com | Ask Ubuntu.]]</nowiki> Tag your post with Ubuntu GNOME.
